<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Credit Facilities and Commercial Paper
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In addition to cash and equivalents and operating cash flow, other sources of liquidity at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;include a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.75 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;revolving credit facility and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$700 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;committed receivables sales facility program. In June 2016, we increased our revolving credit facility from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.75 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and decreased our committed receivables facility program from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$950 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$700 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We also have a commercial paper program of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, backed by the revolving credit facility. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had no amounts outstanding under the revolving credit facility. Availability on the revolving credit facility was reduced by outstanding letters of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$14 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at June 30, 2016. We also had standby letters of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$40 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;issued under the committed receivables sales facility program at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our revolving credit facility and committed receivables sales facility program require us to maintain a consolidated leverage ratio of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no more than 3.25-to-1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and our committed receivables sales facility also requires us to maintain a consolidated interest coverage ratio, as of the end of any calendar quarter, of at least 4-to-1. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we were in compliance with these financial covenants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Available-for-Sale Securities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we held
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$200 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$193 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, respectively, of marketable securities, which are classified as available-for-sale.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Long-Term Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had total long-term obligations of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.0 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risk Management
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We use interest rate swaps, foreign currency contracts and commodity contracts to manage our exposure to cash flow variability. We also use interest rate swaps to protect the value of our debt and use foreign currency forward contracts to protect the value of our existing and forecasted foreign currency assets and liabilities. See the "Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk" section as well as Notes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for information regarding the use of financial instruments and derivatives as well as foreign currency, interest rate and commodity exposures.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

	Capital Deployment
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Capital Expenditures
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Capital expenditures during fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, 2015 and 2014 were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$465 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$300 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$249 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	We expect capital expenditures in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;to be between $400 million and $450 million primarily for information technology projects, growth projects in our core business and integration of the Cordis acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Dividends
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we paid quarterly dividends totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$1.55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;per share, an increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	13 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;from fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On May 4, 2016, our Board of Directors approved a quarterly dividend of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.4489
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.80
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share on an annualized basis, payable on July 15, 2016 to shareholders of record on July 1, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Share Repurchases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our Board of Directors has approved a $2.0 billion share repurchase program, which was completed in July 2016. On May 4, 2016, our Board of Directors also approved an additional $1.0 billion share repurchase program that expires on December 31, 2019. During fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$651 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;of our common shares and from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	July&#160;1, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;through August 5, 2016, we repurchased an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$250 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;of our common shares. We funded the repurchases with available cash. At August 5, 2016, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$793 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#32;remaining under the new repurchase authorization.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Acquisitions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On July 2, 2015, August 26, 2015 and October 2, 2015, we acquired Harvard Drug, naviHealth and Cordis for $1.1 billion (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	net of cash acquired of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$44 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	), $238 million (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	net of cash acquired of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$53 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) and $1.9 billion, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_8"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:20PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:20PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contractual Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our contractual obligations, including estimated payments due by period, are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="20">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:32%;">
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents maturities of our long-term debt obligations and other short-term borrowings excluding capital lease obligations described below. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for further information.

</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents maturities of our capital lease obligations included within long-term obligations in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents cash outflows by period for certain of our liabilities in which cash outflows could be reasonably estimated. Long-term liabilities, such as unrecognized tax benefits and deferred taxes, have been excluded from the table above because of the inherent uncertainty of the underlying tax positions or because of the inability to reasonably estimate the timing of any cash outflows.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for further discussion of income taxes. Additionally, the carrying value of redeemable noncontrolling interests&#160;are excluded from the table, as the ultimate amount and timing of any future cash payments related to the redemption amount are uncertain. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for for additional information regarding redeemable noncontrolling interests.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(4)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents minimum rental payments for operating leases having initial or remaining non-cancelable lease terms as described in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(5)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	A purchase obligation is defined as an agreement to purchase goods or services that is legally enforceable and specifies all significant terms, including fixed or minimum quantities to be purchased; fixed, minimum or variable price provisions; and approximate timing of the transaction. The purchase obligation amounts disclosed above represent estimates of the minimum for which we are obligated and the time period in which cash outflows will occur. Purchase orders and authorizations to purchase that involve no firm commitment from either party are excluded from the above table. In addition, contracts that can be unilaterally canceled with no termination fee or with proper notice are excluded from our total purchase obligations except for the amount of the termination fee or the minimum amount of goods that must be purchased during the requisite notice period. Purchase obligations and other payments also includes quarterly payments of $25.6 million that we are required to pay CVS Health Corporation ("CVS Health"), which commenced in October 2014 in connection with the establishment of Red Oak Sourcing and will be in place for the remaining eight years of the agreement. Purchase obligations and other payments does not include contingent payments under the sourcing venture that were not yet determined as of June 30, 2016, including the quarterly $10 million increase that began in fiscal 2016 and the additional $10 million beginning in the first quarter of fiscal 2017. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for additional information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.01574803149606%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:26%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:52%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:22%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MD&amp;A
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Sensitive Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:20PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:20PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Sensitive Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Critical accounting policies are those accounting policies that (i)&#160;can have a significant impact on our financial condition and results of operations and (ii)&#160;require the use of complex and subjective estimates based upon past experience and management&#8217;s judgment. Other people applying reasonable judgment to the same facts and circumstances could develop different estimates. Because estimates are inherently uncertain, actual results may differ. In this section, we describe the significant policies applied in preparing our consolidated financial statements that management believes are the most dependent on estimates and assumptions. For further discussion of accounting policies for items within this section and of additional accounting policies, see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Trade receivables are presented net of an allowance for doubtful accounts of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$135 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We must use judgment when deciding whether to extend credit to customers and when estimating the required allowance for doubtful accounts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The allowance for doubtful accounts includes general and specific reserves. We determine the appropriate allowance by reviewing accounts receivable aging, industry trends, customer financial strength and credit standing, historical write-off trends and payment history. We also regularly evaluate how changes in economic conditions may affect credit risks.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our methodology for estimating the general reserve is assessed annually based on historical losses and economic, business and market trends. In addition, the allowance is reviewed quarterly and updated if appropriate. We may adjust the allowance for doubtful accounts if changes in customers&#8217; financial condition or general economic conditions make defaults more frequent or severe.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCCCCC;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A hypothetical 0.1 percent increase or decrease in the reserve as a percentage of trade receivables at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, would result in an increase or decrease in bad debt expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe the reserve maintained and expenses recorded in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are appropriate. At this time, we are not aware of any analytical findings or customer issues that are likely to lead to a significant future increase in the allowance for doubtful accounts as a percentage of revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A substantial portion of our inventories (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	58 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	)&#160;are valued at the lower of cost, using the last-in, first-out ("LIFO") method, or market. These are primarily merchandise inventories at the core pharmaceutical distribution facilities within our Pharmaceutical segment. The LIFO impact on the consolidated statements of earnings in a given year depends on pharmaceutical price appreciation and the level of inventory. Prices for branded pharmaceuticals generally tend to rise, which results in an increase in cost of products sold, whereas prices for generic pharmaceuticals generally tend to decline, which results in a decrease in cost of products sold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The LIFO method presumes that the most recent inventory purchases are the first items sold, so LIFO helps us better match current costs and revenue. Using LIFO, if there is a decrease in inventory levels that have experienced pharmaceutical price appreciation, the result generally will be a decrease in future cost of products sold as our older inventory is held at a lower cost. Conversely, if there is a
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease in inventory levels that have experienced a pharmaceutical price decline, the result generally will be an increase in future cost of products sold as our older inventory is held at a higher cost. We believe that the average cost method of inventory valuation reasonably approximates the current cost of replacing inventory within the core pharmaceutical distribution facilities. Accordingly, the LIFO reserve is the difference between (a)&#160;inventory at the lower of LIFO cost or market and (b)&#160;inventory at replacement cost determined using the average cost method of inventory valuation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	If we had used the average cost method of inventory valuation for all inventory within the core pharmaceutical distribution facilities, the value of our inventories would not have changed in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;because inventories valued at LIFO were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$114 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;higher than the average cost value at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. We do not record inventories in excess of replacement cost. As such, the LIFO reserve was zero at both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Our remaining inventory is stated at the lower of cost, using the first-in, first-out method, or market.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:97.4609375%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	19
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cardinal Health
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#EE2724;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	|
</FONT>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.01574803149606%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:26%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:52%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:22%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MD&amp;A
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Sensitive Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inventories presented in the consolidated balance sheets are net of reserves for excess and obsolete inventory which were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$57 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The increase primarily reflects inventory reserves pertaining to Cordis.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We reserve for inventory obsolescence using estimates based on historical experience, historical and projected sales trends, specific
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	categories of inventory and age of on-hand inventory. If actual conditions are less favorable than our assumptions, additional inventory reserves may be required.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Business Combinations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a business combination, including identifiable intangible assets, are recorded at their estimated fair values as of the acquisition date. The excess of the purchase price over the estimated fair value of the identifiable net assets acquired is recorded as goodwill. We base the fair values of identifiable intangible assets on detailed valuations that require management to make significant judgments, estimates and assumptions. Critical estimates and assumptions include: expected
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	future cash flows for customer relationships, trademarks, trade names, patents, developed technology, in-process research and development and other identifiable intangible assets; discount rates that reflect the risk factors associated with future cash flows; and estimates of useful lives. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for additional information regarding our acquisitions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Purchased goodwill and intangible assets with indefinite lives are tested for impairment annually or when indicators of impairment exist.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill impairment testing involves judgment, including the identification of reporting units, the estimation of the fair value of each reporting unit and, if necessary, the estimation of the implied fair value of goodwill.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our determination of estimated fair value of our reporting units is based on a combination of the income-based and market-based approaches. Under the income-based approach, we use a discounted cash flow model in which cash flows anticipated over several future periods, plus a terminal value at the end of that time horizon, are discounted to their present value using an appropriate risk-adjusted rate of return.&#160;We use our internal forecasts to estimate future cash flows, which we believe are consistent with those of a market participant, and include an estimate of long-term growth rates based on our most recent views of the long-term outlook for each reporting unit. Actual results may differ materially from those used in our forecasts. We use discount rates that are commensurate with the risks and uncertainty inherent in the respective reporting units and in our internally-developed forecasts. Discount rates used in our reporting unit valuations ranged from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.5 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12.5 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Under the market-based approach, we determine fair value by comparing our reporting units to similar businesses or guideline companies whose securities are actively traded in public markets. Estimating the fair value of reporting units requires the use of estimates and significant judgments that are based on a number of factors including actual operating results. The use of alternate estimates and assumptions or changes in the industry or peer groups could materially affect the determination of fair value for each reporting unit and potentially result in goodwill impairment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We performed annual impairment testing in fiscal 2016, 2015 and 2014 and concluded that there were no impairments of goodwill as the estimated fair value of each reporting unit exceeded its carrying value. If we were to alter our impairment testing by increasing the discount rate in the discounted cash flow analysis by 1 percent, there still would not be any impairment indicated for any of our reporting units for fiscal 2016, 2015 or 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The impairment test for indefinite-lived intangibles other than goodwill (primarily in-process research and development ("IPR&amp;D")) requires comparing the fair value of the indefinite-lived intangible asset to the carrying value of the asset as of the impairment testing date. We estimate the fair value of our indefinite-lived intangibles under the income approach using a discounted cash flow model. We use our internal forecasts to estimate future cash flows, which we believe are consistent with those of a market participant, and include an estimate of long-term growth rates based on our most recent views of the long-term outlook for the indefinite-lived intangible including, among other factors, assumptions on regulatory approval for IPR&amp;D.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Intangible assets with finite lives, primarily customer relationships; trademarks, trade names and patents; and developed technology, are amortized using a combination of straight-line and accelerated methods based on the expected cash flows from the asset over their estimated useful lives. We review intangible assets with finite lives for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the related carrying amounts may not be recoverable. Determining whether an impairment loss occurred requires estimating future undiscounted cash flows expected to be generated by the asset group. Actual results may differ materially from those used in our forecasts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:34%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cardinal Health
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#EE2724;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	|
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;Fiscal 2016 Form 10-K
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	20
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.01574803149606%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:26%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:52%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:22%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MD&amp;A
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Sensitive Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vendor Reserves
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In the ordinary course of business, our vendors may dispute deductions taken against payments otherwise due to them or assert other disputes. These disputed transactions are researched and resolved based upon findings of the research performed. At any given time, there are outstanding items in various stages of research and resolution. In determining appropriate reserves for areas of exposure with our vendors, we assess historical experience and current outstanding claims. We have established various levels of reserves based on the type of claim and status of review. Though the transaction types are relatively consistent, we periodically refine our methodology by updating the reserve estimate percentages to reflect actual historical experience. Changes to the estimate percentages affect the cost of products sold in the period in which the change was made.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Vendor reserves were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$62 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$88 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Approximately 66 percent of the vendor reserve at the end of fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;pertained to the Pharmaceutical segment compared to 75 percent at the end of fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The reserve balance will fluctuate due to variations in outstanding claims from period-to-period, timing of settlements and specific vendor issues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The ultimate outcome of specific claims may be different than our original estimate and may require adjustment. We believe, however, that reserves recorded for such disputes are reasonable based upon current facts and circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loss Contingencies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We accrue for contingencies related to disputes, litigation and regulatory matters if it is probable that a liability has been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. Because these matters are inherently unpredictable and unfavorable developments or resolutions can occur, assessing contingencies is highly subjective and requires judgments about future events.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We regularly review contingencies to determine whether our accruals and related disclosures are adequate. The amount of ultimate loss may differ from these estimates. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for additional information regarding loss contingencies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_10"></A>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Total deferred income tax assets included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$193 million
</FONT>

	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of loss and tax credit forwards at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, respectively.

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	This valuation allowance primarily relates to federal, state and international loss carryforwards for which the ultimate realization of future benefits is uncertain.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Expiring loss and credit carryforwards and the required valuation allowances are adjusted quarterly. After applying the valuation
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	allowances, we do not anticipate any limitations on our use of any of the other net deferred income tax assets described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe that our estimates for the valuation allowances against deferred tax assets and unrecognized tax benefits are appropriate based on current facts and circumstances. However, others applying reasonable judgment to the same facts and circumstances could develop different estimates. The amount we ultimately pay when matters are resolved may differ from the amounts accrued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Tax benefits from uncertain tax positions are recognized when it is more likely than not that the position will be sustained upon examination of the technical merits of the position, including resolutions of any related appeals or litigation processes. The amount recognized is measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than 50 percent likely of being realized upon settlement. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the &#8220;Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&#8221; for additional information regarding unrecognized tax benefits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	If any of our assumptions or estimates were to change, an increase or decrease in our effective income tax rate by 1 percent would have caused income tax expense to increase or decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$23 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.01574803149606%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MD&amp;A
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Sensitive Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Share-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='DISPLAY:INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH:100%;'>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Share-based compensation provided to employees is recognized in the consolidated statements of earnings based on the grant date fair value of the awards. The fair value of restricted share units and performance share units is determined by the grant date market price of our common shares. The compensation expense associated with nonvested performance share units is dependent on our periodic assessment of the probability of the targets being achieved and our estimate, which may vary over time, of the number of shares that ultimately will be issued. The fair value of stock options is determined using a lattice valuation model. We believe the lattice model provides reasonable estimates because it has the ability to take into account employee exercise patterns based on changes in our stock price and other variables and it provides for a range of input assumptions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID='PAGEBREAK' STYLE='WIDTH:2%; FLOAT:LEFT;'>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE='FLOAT:RIGHT; WIDTH:49%;'>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We analyze historical data to estimate option exercise behaviors and post-vesting forfeitures to be used within the lattice model. The expected life of the options granted is calculated from the option valuation model and represents the length of time in years that the options granted are expected to be outstanding. Expected volatilities are based on implied volatility from traded options on our common shares and historical volatility over a period of time commensurate with the contractual term of the option grant (up to ten years). As required, the forfeiture estimates are adjusted to reflect actual forfeitures when an award vests. The actual forfeitures in future reporting periods could be higher or lower than our current estimates. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the "Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements" for additional information regarding share-based compensation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:34%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cardinal Health
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#EE2724;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	|
</FONT>

	&#160;Fiscal 2016 Form 10-K
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	22
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.21259842519686%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:52%;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Explanation and Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #E41F35;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
